0.quote: Anyone who has lost track of time when using a computer knows the propensity to dream, the urge to make dreams come true and the tendency to miss lunch.
0.author: Tim Berners-Lee

2.quote: Data is a precious thing and will last longer than the systems themselves.
2.author: Tim Berners-Lee

3.quote: If you are not on the web, you will have problems accessing services.
3.author: Tim Berners-Lee

4.quote: You affect the world by what you browse.
4.author: Tim Berners-Lee

5.quote: Things can change so fast on the internet.
5.author: Tim Berners-Lee

6.quote: It's difficult to imagine the power that you're going to have when so many different sorts of data are available.
6.author: Tim Berners-Lee

7.quote: That idea of URL was the basic clue to the universality of the Web. That was the only thing I insisted upon.
7.author: Tim Berners-Lee

8.quote: The Domain Name Server (DNS) is the Achilles heel of the Web. The important thing is that it's managed responsibly.
8.author: Tim Berners-Lee

9.quote: The important thing is the diversity available on the Web.
9.author: Tim Berners-Lee

10.quote: Innovation is serendipity, so you don't know what people will make.
10.author: Tim Berners-Lee

11.quote: The most important thing that was new was the idea of URI-or URL, that any piece of information anywhere should have an identifier, which will allow you to get hold of it.
11.author: Tim Berners-Lee

12.quote: The power of the Web is in its universality. Access by everyone regardless of disability is an essential aspect.
12.author: Tim Berners-Lee

13.quote: The Web does not just connect machines, it connects people.
13.author: Tim Berners-Lee

14.quote: The web is more a social creation than a technical one. I designed it for a social effect - to help people work together - and not as a technical toy.
14.author: Tim Berners-Lee

15.quote: The Web as I envisaged it, we have not seen it yet. The future is still so much bigger than the past.
15.author: Tim Berners-Lee

16.quote: When I invented the Web, I didn't have to ask anyone's permission. Now, hundreds of millions of people are using it freely. I am worried that that is going end in the USA.
16.author: Tim Berners-Lee

17.quote: I invented the web just because I needed it really because it was so frustrating that it didn't exit.
17.author: Tim Berners-Lee

18.quote: We need diversity of thought in the world to face the new challenges.
18.author: Tim Berners-Lee

19.quote: When you understand things, there's no more magic.
19.author: Tim Berners-Lee

20.quote: Physicists analyze systems. Web scientists, however, can create the systems.
20.author: Tim Berners-Lee

21.quote: The Mobile Web Initiative is important - information must be made seamlessly available on any device.
21.author: Tim Berners-Lee

22.quote: I hope we will use the Net to cross barriers and connect cultures.
22.author: Tim Berners-Lee

23.quote: My own personal preference is that the consumer, the individual person should be protected because individual people and the difference between individual people and the diversity we have between people on the planet is so important.
23.author: Tim Berners-Lee

24.quote: It was the academic community who wired up their universities so it was put together by smart, well-meaning people who thought it was a good idea.
24.author: Tim Berners-Lee

25.quote: It is the the duty of a Webmaster to allocate URIs which you will be able to stand by in 2 years, in 20 years, in 200 years.
25.author: Tim Berners-Lee

26.quote: The ultimate goal of the Web is to support and improve our weblike existence in the world. We clump into families, associations, and companies.
26.author: Tim Berners-Lee

27.quote: Now, if someone tries to monopolize the Web, for example pushes proprietary variations on network protocols, then that would make me unhappy.
27.author: Tim Berners-Lee

28.quote: I don't mind being, in the public context, referred to as the inventor of the World Wide Web. What I like is that image to be separate from private life, because celebrity damages private life.
28.author: Tim Berners-Lee

29.quote: Details matter, it's worth waiting to get it right.
29.author: Steve Jobs

30.quote: The fundamental truth for developers is they will build if there are users.
30.author: Satya Nadella

31.quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
31.author: Douglas Adams

32.quote: Java is to JavaScript what Car is to Carpet.
32.author: Chris Heilmann

33.quote: Linux is only free if your time has no value.
33.author: Jamie Zawinski

35.quote: One man’s constant is another man’s variable.
35.author: Alan J. Perlis

36.quote: Software is like sex: It’s better when it’s free.
36.author: Linus Torvalds

37.quote: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
37.author: Jim Highsmith

38.quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
38.author: Oscar Wilde

39.quote: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
39.author: Albert Einstein

40.quote: Talk is cheap, show me the code!
40.author: Linus Torvalds
